title.narrative: EISA 2019-2022, ADS IV Africa Democracy Strengthening Programme
EISA 2019-2022, ADS IV Africa Democracy Strengthening Programme

description.narrative: Programme support to EISA to strengthen democracy in Africa, The programme aims to contribute to stronger regional democratic institutions, with increased participation from citizens on sub-regional and national level in Africa. EISA works with ECCAS, ECOWAS, SADC, EAC and ICGLS and provides tailored support in order for these institutions to play their role in relation to electoral processes in members states in a more qualitative way. In addition, EISA works on national level in a number of countries, including Madagascar and Senegal to support a more inclusive democratic culture in political parties, to provide support to womens' and youth groups, and encourage qualitative interaction between civil society actors and parliaments.

Programstöd till EISA för att stärka demokratiutveckling i Afrika. Programmet syftar till att bidra till starkare regionala demokratiska institutioner, med ökat deltagande från medborgare, på sub-regional och nationell nivå i Afrika. EISA arbetar med ECCAS, ECOWAS, SADC, EAC och ICGLR och ger dessa institutioner skräddarsytt stöd i syfte att dessa institutioner ska kunna spela sin roll i relation till valprocesser i medlemsländer, på ett mer kvalitativt sätt. Därutöver arbetar EISA i ett antal länder, däribland Madagaskar och Senegal för att stödja en mer inkluderande demokratisk kultur i politiska partier, och att främja ökad kvalitativ interaktion mellan civilsamhällesaktörer och parlament, med särskilt fokus på kvinnors och ungas deltagande.

The long-term impact objective is: More credible electoral and democratic political processes in Africa Programme outcome objective: Stronger and more effective democratic institutions with greater citizen participation at sub-regional and continental levels and in selected African countries EISA will work toward these goals by providing technical support to Regional Economic Communities in Africa to strengthen their engagement in member states' electoral processes and by conducting training in election-related issues to political parties. In addition, EISA works on national level - in Madagascar, Senegal and other countries based on needs and opportunities - to strengthen parliaments and to foster inclusive democratic culture, policy and practice.

participating-org.narrative: EISA/Electoral Institute for Sustainable Democracy in Africa

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Based on the report for 2019, it is noted that EISA is slightly behind schedule. Outcome 2: Key stakeholders play a constructive role in electoral processes and systems, 3: Capacity of legislatures to be effective and responsive enhanced, and 6: EISA is a professional, well-managed, innovative and influential organisation, are on track but outcome 1: Capacity of continental and sub-regional institutions to assess elections enhanced, is moderately behind and outcome 4: Political parties capacitated to be more effective, democratic and inclusive of women and youth, is behind schedule (activities related to outcome 5: Capacity of civil society to mobilise citizen participation in public affairs and influence reforms strengthened, will start in 2020). Several elections have been postponed to 2020 and therefore related activities have also been postponed, in addition to some acitivities planned too close to elections have been rescheduled as relevant attendees have been to busy with elections/campaigning etc. Examples of results from the 2019 report and follow-up during 2020, based on the particular interest that the Embassy has expressed in EISA's support to ECCAS on one hand, and EISA's own election observation on the other hand. EISA have produced knowledge materials together with ECCAS, trained 22 ECCAS election observers and held advocacy visits on "principles governing democratic elections in Central Africa". Technical support was provided to ECCAS' pre-electoral missions to Burundi and CAR in 2020; support was given to Electoral Commissions of ECCAS member states in the field of media awareness, prevention of conflict and hate speech, and voting procedures. EISA concludes that ECCAS makes use of EISA support, for instance pre-electoral assessment methodology. EISA deployed an international Election Observation Mission to the presidential and parliamentary elections in Tunisia. The mission was led by former President of Mauritius, Cassam Uteem, and consisted of 4 LTOs, 16 STOs and a technical assessment team of 6 experts deployed to the voting phase of the runoff presidential election. During 2020, EISA performed two Election Observation missions - one to Tanzania and one to Côte d'Ivoire. See statements in the file. Two editions of the Journal of African Elections have been issued during 2020. The activities in the Madagascar project have been picking up, including efforts to counteract the decrease of women's participation in decision-making processes, and support to the parliament, its staff and to female MPs. A regional office in Abidjan was opened with Swedish support. In addition, EISA has been able to attract additional funding on country level.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
